arch:property.oc:show_val: L36 is loose silty fill above compacted mudbrick debris located at the NE corner of L33. We orginally thought it was a pit that is why we changed locus from L33 but it is not a pit because we found layers of mudbrick like fill a few centimeters below the surface. We cleared off all of the soft fill from the area and decided to keep the locus open as mixed fill abutting the surfaces and fills L37, L40, L42. We cut the area down little by little with each surface. It appeared there might be mudbrick associated with this area in the fill in L43 that connected to this locus but our findings were inconclusive. It is not clear where the pit ends but it may extend into L35 and we may have chopped through it early on. In the section we can see a large area of very soft crumbling fill. We did not have enough time to further excavate this area so we closed it.
possibly a pit with some mudbrick debris
loose silty fill on top of hard mudbrick like fill, possibly a pit that cuts the series of surfaces adjacent to this fill

arch:note.arch:string: Contexts excavated in trenches were recorded using the "locus system." A locus is any discrete three-dimensional entity excavated in a trench. The key to the locus system is the recognition that a locus is any one thing. Differences in soil composition or texture are therefore as important as, for example, the difference between a pit and a wall. If two entities were distinct, they were considered separate loci and were therefore assigned separate locus numbers. It should also be noted that every context excavated in a trench was given a locus number and thus the trench itself is made up completely of excavated loci.

arch:property.oc:show_val: mixed ashy fill with mudbrick debris
pit with mudbrick debris, not fully excavated
